issue.title: [Rust] PrimitiveArray<T> should support comparison operators
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-3881](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3881). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
PrimitiveArray<T> should support comparison operators such as <, <=, >, >=, ==, != so that two arrays (of the same type) can be compared and produce a PrimitiveArray<bool> containing the result.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3881?focusedCommentId=16710779) by Andy Grove (andygrove):*
I've implemented this as part of the PR for ARROW-3880 since the code is so closely related

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3881?focusedCommentId=16718257) by Andy Grove (andygrove):*
This was handled in [https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3033 ](https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3033)along with ARROW-3880
